intro: Scabiosa balansae, commonly known as the Balkan scabious, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences of pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branched. Scabiosa balansae is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
